artview.components.GridDisplay¶

class artview.components.GridDisplay(Vgrid=None, Vfield=None, VlevelZ=None, VlevelY=None, VlevelX=None, Vlimits=None, Vcolormap=None, plot_type='gridZ', name='Display', parent=None)[source]¶

Bases: artview.core.core.Component

Class to create a display plot, using a Grid structure.

__init__(Vgrid=None, Vfield=None, VlevelZ=None, VlevelY=None, VlevelX=None, Vlimits=None, Vcolormap=None, plot_type='gridZ', name='Display', parent=None)[source]¶

Initialize the class to create display.

Parameters:

[Optional] :

Vgrid : Variable instance

grid signal variable. If None start new one with None.

Vfield : Variable instance

Field signal variable. If None start new one with empty string.

VlevelZ : Variable instance

Signal variable for vertical level, only used if plot_type=”gridZ”. If None start with value zero.

VlevelY : Variable instance

Signal variable for latitudinal level, only used if plot_type=”gridY”. If None start with value zero.

VlevelX : Variable instance

Signal variable for longitudinal level, only used if plot_type=”gridX”. If None start with value zero.

Vlimits : Variable instance

Limits signal variable. A value of None will instantiate a limits variable.

Vcolormap : Variable instance

Colormap signal variable. A value of None will instantiate a colormap variable.

plot_type : “gridZ”, “gridY” or “gridX”

Define plot type, “gridZ” will plot a Z level, that is a XY plane. Analog for “gridY” and “gridZ”

name : string

Display window name.

parent : PyQt instance

Parent instance to associate to Display window. If None, then Qt owns, otherwise associated with parent PyQt instance.

Notes

This class records the selected button and passes the change value back to variable.

Methods

GridDisplay.FieldSelectCmd(name) Captures field selection and update field
GridDisplay.LaunchGUI() Launches a GUI interface.
GridDisplay.LevelSelectCmd(nlevel) Captures Level selection and update Level
GridDisplay.NewColormap(variable, strong) Slot for ‘ValueChanged’ signal of
GridDisplay.NewField(variable, strong) Slot for ‘ValueChanged’ signal of
GridDisplay.NewGrid(variable, strong) Slot for ‘ValueChanged’ signal of
GridDisplay.NewLevel(variable, strong) Slot for ‘ValueChanged’ signal of
GridDisplay.NewLimits(variable, strong) Slot for ‘ValueChanged’ signal of
GridDisplay.addButtons() Add a series of buttons for user control over display.
GridDisplay.change_plot_type(plot_type) Change plot type.
GridDisplay.cmapSelectCmd(cm_name) Captures colormap selection and redraws.
GridDisplay.getField() get current field
GridDisplay.getNearestPoints(xdata, ydata) Return the bins values nearest to point.
GridDisplay.getPathInteriorValues(paths) Return the bins values path.
GridDisplay.getPlotAxis() get matplotlib.axes.Axes instance of main plot
GridDisplay.getStatusBar() get PyQt4.QtGui.QStatusBar instance
GridDisplay.getUnits() get current units
GridDisplay.guiStart([parent]) Graphical interface for starting this class
GridDisplay.keyPressEvent(event) Allow level adjustment via the Up-Down arrow keys.
GridDisplay.parse_plot_type(plot_type) Parse Plot Type and change variables
GridDisplay.setUILayout() Setup the button/display UI layout.
GridDisplay.toolDefaultCmd() Restore the Display defaults.
GridDisplay.toolResetCmd() Reset tools via disconnect.
GridDisplay.toolSelectRegionCmd() Creates and connects to Region of Interest instance.
GridDisplay.toolValueClickCmd() Creates and connects to Point-and-click value retrieval
GridDisplay.toolZoomPanCmd() Creates and connects to a Zoom/Pan instance.

Attributes

Vcolormap = None¶

see Shared Variables Table

Vfield = None¶

see Shared Variables Table

Vgrid = None¶

see Shared Variables Table

Vlevel¶

Alias to VlevelZ, VlevelY or VlevelX depending on plot_type.

VlevelX = None¶

see Shared Variables Table, only used if plot_type=”gridX”

VlevelY = None¶

see Shared Variables Table, only used if plot_type=”gridY”

VlevelZ = None¶

see Shared Variables Table, only used if plot_type=”gridZ”

VpathInteriorFunc = None¶

see Shared Variables Table (no internal use)

VplotAxes = None¶

see Shared Variables Table (no internal use)

levels¶

Values from the axes of grid, depending on plot_type.
